case_vignette: A 32-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department by her neighbors 30 minutes after they found her unconscious in her yard. Her neighbors report that she has been spending more time at home by herself because she recently lost her job. On arrival, she is unable to provide a history. She appears anxious. Her pulse is 76/min, respirations are 13/min, and blood pressure is 114/72 mm Hg. Examination shows significant weakness of the left upper and lower extremities. She is unable to plantarflex the ankle while supine. She is able to stand on her toes. Her gait is unsteady. Deep tendon reflexes are 3+ and symmetric. A CT scan of the head shows no abnormalities. An MRI of the brain and MR angiography show no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I was found unconscious in my yard and now I feel really weak on the left side of my body.
Have you had any recent head injuries or loss of consciousness before this incident?
I was found unconscious today, but I can't remember if I had a head injury.
Did you experience any headache, confusion, or trouble speaking before you were found unconscious?
I can't provide a history of what happened before I was found unconscious.
Do you have a history of high blood pressure, diabetes, or any cardiovascular disease?
I can't provide a history of my medical conditions right now.
Are you currently experiencing any difficulty speaking or seeing, or any confusion?
I appear anxious and I'm unable to provide a history, which could suggest confusion.
Do you have any known allergies or are you taking any medications?
I can't provide that information right now.
Can you tell me your age and whether you have a family history of stroke, heart disease, or other neurological conditions?
I'm 32 years old, but I can't provide information about my family history.
Has your strength improved at all since you initially felt weak, or has it remained the same?
My strength has not improved; my left side still feels significantly weak.
Are you currently experiencing any numbness or tingling on one side of your body or face?
I haven't said anything about experiencing numbness or tingling.
I understand. Can you tell me if you are having any trouble with your vision?
I didn't mention having any trouble with my vision.
Have you had any issues with dizziness, balance, or coordination since the incident?
My gait is unsteady.
Have you experienced any seizures or changes in your awareness or alertness?
I was found unconscious, but I haven't mentioned any seizures or changes in alertness since then.

Given the information provided:

**Final Diagnosis:** Suspected ischemic stroke.
